com.appriskgame.controller

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.appriskgame.controller.Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains methods which will take the input to add or remove players , Populate countries to players randomly , to allocate armies to the players initially and then place the remaining armies in round robin fashion. Contains methods for Reinforcement, Attack and fortification phase.
    Author:
    Sahana, Surya, Shruthi, Dolly, Sai

        public void startReinforcement(GamePlayer player,
                               GameMap mapDetails)

      • assignReinforcedArmies

                                  Continent continent)

        Parameters:
        player - - The player to whom armies will be allocated to
        continent - - Continent to which the player belongs to
        Returns:
        armies to be assigned to any country of players choice

      • startGameFortification

        public boolean startGameFortification(GamePlayer player,
                                      GameMap gameMap)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        This method is called from the Startup phase when the user opts to start the fortification. It internally calls the moveArmies method once all the validation with respect to fortification are performed.
        Parameters:
        player - The player who is doing fortification.
        gameMap - GameMap object
        Returns:
        true if fortification is possible else false
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - throws Input-Output exception

      • isArmyCountSufficient

        public boolean isArmyCountSufficient(int armyCount,
                                     Country givingCountry)
        This method checks if the provided army count is sufficient for fortification.
        Parameters:
        armyCount - Number of armies to move
        givingCountry - Country name where armies are moved from
        Returns:
        true if the army count is insufficient or else false

      • moveArmies

        public boolean moveArmies(Country fromCountry,
                          Country toCountry,
                          int armiesCount)
        This method takes the values for each player from the startFortification method and does the manipulation of armies and assign the armies
        Parameters:
        fromCountry - The country from where player want to move army
        toCountry - The country to where player want to move army
        armiesCount - Count of armies player wish to move
        Returns:
        true if armies are moved else false
